title: The warmest cities in South America
summary: The chart shows the warmest cities in South America .
Belem is the warmest at 36 degrees , followed by Montevideo at 29 degrees , and Lima at 35 degrees .
Next is Cordoba at 23 degrees , followed by Santiago at 20 degrees and finally Bogota at 16 degrees ( approximate ) .
gold: This chart shows the temperature in degrees Celsius in 6 South American cities . The warmest is Belem with 36 , followed by Montevideo with 29 , Lima with 25 , Cordoba with 23 , Santiago with 20 , and finally Bogota with 16 .
